articleData.blog_content:
On Friday, after more than 4 years of the Nirbhaya rape and murder incident and over 3 years after the culprits were found guilty and sentenced to death, the supreme court shot down the convicts appeal against the conviction and upheld the the death sentence bringing to a close a long and harrowing wait for justice. The judges stated their crime fell in the rarest of rare category and deserved capital punishment.

The court referred to the dying declarations by Nirbhaya as evidence to prove guilt and rejected the claims of the convicts that the dying declarations were unreliable.

The crime had sparked massive outrage all across the nation and raised serious questions about the safety of women in not only the capital but the entire country. The incident created a massive movement to bring forth necessary change in laws aimed at protecting women from crimes and attitude of the society towards women. The verdict has thus brought a sigh of relief to everyone following the case.

However there are still several other Nirbhayas across the nation that are still awaiting justice and several whose voices go unheard each day. This verdict is a step in the right direction towards creating a society where women can feel safe and its up to all of us to contribute towards that change.
articleData.blog_headline: SC Upholds Death Sentence to Nirbhaya Gang Rape Convicts
